sub_title: Organisational Psychology | Organisational Development | Learning & Development | Talent Management | HRD | Empowering people to lead themselves into a brighter future
summary:
I am passionate about people, learning, human development and Organisational Psychology. I am invested in the wellbeing of employees and am committed to developing and implementing organisational improvements in order to cultivate sustainable cultural change. As a practitioner of fresh, strategic and creative thinking I value the importance of continuous learning and believe that inspiring leaders, role models and collaboration are integral parts of what positive change looks like.  

People are key to organisations and to me. I want to help people achieve what they want to achieve in their careers and feel strongly about supporting them in becoming the best version of themselves. As an advocate for Diversity & Inclusion I believe that every person is unique and has their own story to tell. This should be respected, celebrated and nurtured. Encouraging diversity of thought unlocks a whole world of possibilities! 

A HR professional with a strong international background, extensive experience working in international contexts on a global level and a bilingual proficiency in English and Dutch. Work experience in the Netherlands, New Zealand, Australia and the UK.

awards.title: Hudson Company Awards
awards.description: Voted best performer of all New Zealand employees of my service line by my peers.

awards.title: Tourism College Knowledge Award
awards.description: Awarded top ranked student of a KLM sponsored countrywide tourism knowledge test. Award received from KLM's CEO at Vakantiebeurs in Utrecht, the Netherlands (national holiday fair). I was interviewed and appeared on TV.

certifications.name: Training for Trainers: An Authenticity workshop

profile_positions.description:
My knowledge, skills and abilities would be suited for Human Resource Development and Recruitment roles in a private or public sector setting or an academic equivalent such as a Study Advisor or Education Development Officer position. 

How could I add value to your team and organisation? 

My Organisational and Learning & Development skills add value to organisations as by developing and training employees, employees feel more empowered and satisfied in their jobs leading to increased productivity levels and lower levels of sick leave.

In addition, I am a strong team player, tenacious, have excellent influencing and relationship management skills, am a creative thinker, resourceful, a problem solver, am adaptable, have a very high learning agility, have strong (intercultural) communication, analytical, research and organisation skills, am development, improvement and results driven, am customer focused, loyal, curious, an optimist and truly care about the wellbeing of people so they can thrive. 

I would excel in an inclusive work environment.

Please have a look at the skills listed towards the bottom of the page to see if this matches your requirements.
profile_positions.title: Organisational Development Advisor | Learning & Development Advisor | Study Advisor | Available

profile_positions.description:
Since my return to the Netherlands after 10+ years abroad, I continuously invest in the process of establishing myself in Dutch society and refamiliaring myself with the Dutch way of life. During my time working and studying HRM overseas I have become well versed in working with people from different cultural backgrounds, international employment laws and best HR practices. Reading and communicating in cultural nuances has become second nature to me.

Completed an Organisational Development certificate, I am a certified REACH Ecosystem Practitioner. The REACH Ecosystem is a People & Culture Solution that brings together people and culture performance solutions in a unique, evidence-based ecosystem. Developed over 10 years with input from 1000's of leaders, trainers, coaches, org psychs, CEO's and innovative IT specialists from countries across the world.

To pursue my passion for Organisational Psychology and further develop my knowledge, skills and abilities, I have commenced a Bachelor of Organisational Psychology at NCOI on an extramural part-time basis. 

I am currently open to work, beschikb@@r.
profile_positions.title: Move from New Zealand to the Netherlands, study Org Development & Organisational Psychology

profile_positions.description:
As an Organisational Development Advisor (generalist) I contributed to projects and work programmes to design, develop, implement and manage strategic people capability initiatives to deliver lasting cultural change. These aligned with government priorities and MOJ's business strategy. This included:

- Conducted research & analysis, proposed options aligning with HR strategy outcomes 
- Engaged with the business to ensure proposals are fit for purpose 
- Prepared reports and recommendations 
- Developed, monitored, reported on and implemented programmes and initiatives 
- Identified opportunities for continuous improvement, identified issues/risks
- Engaged in extensive networking and relationship management with internal & external stakeholders
- Contributed to a positive team culture, brainstormed, was a sounding board with constructive feedback
- Proactively supported team members to deliver work priorities on time with quality standards, shared knowledge

Key projects:

- D&I Lead: Managed D&I strategy implementation, collaborated on Gender Pay Gap initiatives, managed the Ministry's participation in a research study, contact for all D&I matters, communicated D&I success stories to all staff, co-organised a D&I themed day (50 people)
- Reward & Recognition - CEO Awards Lead: Used a design thinking approach and implemented a programme refresh on behalf of the CEO
- Leadership Development (largest project): Managed 360 Feedback, evaluated programmes, identified & implemented improvements, actively participated in think tanks
- Coaching: back office support/advice on coaching initiatives

Advised & supported on:

- Talent Management
- Wellbeing
- Exit surveys
- Engagement

Researched all Ministry D&I initiatives to date and developed a D&I Agency Profile that tells a story of the Ministry's D&I journey. It outlines MOJ's commitment to building and celebrating a diverse and inclusive workplace. It provides a snapshot of the work MOJ is doing and the progress made.
profile_positions.title: Organisational Development Advisor

profile_positions.description: Conducted additional Diversity & Inclusion research next to my Diversity & Inclusion university requirements and shared this with other Organisational Development professionals to support their Diversity & Inclusion initiatives.
profile_positions.title: Completing a Human Resource Management qualification full-time

profile_positions.description:
I was contracted to MSD to work on the ACTSAFE programme. ACTSAFE was established after a fatal shooting occurred in one of MSD's offices. The purpose of the programme was to train all 12,000+ employees to prevent this terrible incident from happening again. I felt strongly about adding value to this programme. 

I worked at MSD in a Training Advisor, Training Coordinator and LMS Specialist capacity. My duties included:

- Research, analysis and mapping of a new induction programme for all (12,000+) staff, this included a stocktake, grading of existing fragmentation of induction materials to make it fit for purpose and identified improvement opportunities, provided written programme content
- Identified training gaps of writing capabilities of cohorts of staff and liaised with suppliers regarding fit for purpose blended training possibilities based on adult learning principles
- Storyboarded with instructional designers on H&S learning solutions adhering to H&S legislation 
- Proactively supported the team by brainstorming and acting as a sounding board 
- Administered a Totara LMS, included building learning pages, badge design and trouble shooting
- Logistical planning, deployment of H&S learning solutions and managed staff training compliance in accordance with MSD regulations. Created heatmaps to effectively manage training compliance and organised regional training days for staff to complete their mandatory training
- Prepared reports on training completion tracking and training trends within the organisation. 

Developed LMS standards, received feedback from leadership of these being of fantastic quality.
profile_positions.title: Training Advisor/Coordinator/LMS specialist

profile_positions.description:
Learning Management Advisor - People & Capability

- Solely responsible for all Ministry L&D needs
- Managed learning queries and a Totara LMS, included building learning pages, troubleshooting and all Ministry courses
- Managed and facilitated orientation workshops for new employees
- Ensured the smooth running of the L&D programme included marketing to cost efficiently run workshops, problem-solved user queries, proactively determined and met organisational needs
- Negotiated and finalised new contracts for services with external suppliers to deliver workshops
- Maintained the contract schedule for external providers, ensured performance requirements were met, highlighted exceptions to managers and planned timely re-tendering
- Researched, analysed, advised and prepared reports on L&D trends within the organisation included workshop evaluations
- Built and maintained relationships with staff, managers, facilitators, external L&D professionals as a trusted advisor. Participated in LMS user forums
- Advised on and processed Study Assistance (qualifications framework) queries/applications 
- Participated in change management workshops.

Developed a LMS administrator user guide for the Ministry's LMS to encourage knowledge retention and user efficiency. 

Project Coordinator - National Health Committee (NHC). A top tier executive advisory team to the Minister of Health. I worked on a variety of projects.

Key projects:

- Gained an understanding of in-house end-to-end recruitment processes whilst leading a recruitment project to fill several newly created positions. This included writing job descriptions and advertisements
- Coordinated end-to-end recruitment needs within teams and filled numerous vacancies.

Other duties included:

- Met deadlines of collating monthly Committee board papers to present to the NHC
- Provided quality and timely support to the NHC, support included project coordination, managed Committee chair & General Manager's needs.
profile_positions.title: Learning Management Advisor

profile_positions.description:
Hudson is a global talent solutions company specialising in Recruitment, Talent Management and Recruitment Process Outsourcing (RPO).

During my time at Hudson Global I performed duties as a Recruitment and Training Coordinator and an Associate Consultant. Work out of New Zealand and Australian offices. Duties included:

- Solely ran technical training for the Wellington branch as a superuser
- Attended training for trainers in Sydney to train staff on new technical functionalities
- Facilitated leader and non-leader group training, 1:1 training, non-leader coaching and mentoring 
- Point of contact for a large international Learning and Development technical project
- Performed technical testing for several international training projects
- Acted as an Associate Consultant when short staffed, included sourcing, interviewing candidates and analysing psychometric assessments
- Provided recruitment support to 30 consultants; duties included reference checking, drawing up employment contracts, preparing candidate CVs for clients, running reports, advised on company procedure queries, invoicing, completed security checks. 

Hudson Company Awards; voted best performer of all New Zealand employees of my service line by my peers.
profile_positions.title: Associate Consultant/Recruitment Coordinator and Trainer

profile_positions.description: Recruitment Coordination assignments, included a role as a Recruitment Coordinator at Deloitte where I successfully secured high caliber candidates to fill numerous positions within the company. This was achieved by coordinating end-to-end recruitment processes, preparing candidates for interviews and analysing psychometric assessment results.
profile_positions.title: Contract work via Hudson Global

profile_positions.description:
Thetford is an international manufacturing company that has a passion for travelling and camping. They are the leading global supplier of mobile sanitation systems, cooking and refrigeration appliances. 

As the Order Desk Attendant for the UK market I:

- Managed end-to-end order processes
- Provided customers with service excellence
- Liaised internally with Accounting, Logistics and Distribution departments to meet customer needs
- Financial control over customer accounts ie. issuing credit/debit notes and pro forma invoices
- Controlled and managed deviation of deliveries and monitored nonconformity deliveries.

Significantly increased customer satisfaction whilst migrating the Order Desk UK from the UK to the Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Order Desk Attendant UK

profile_positions.description: A working holiday scheme allows young people to work to supplement their travel funds and travel the designated country. I worked as an office administrator during my time in New Zealand.
profile_positions.title: Gap year work experience

profile_positions.description:
Managed the hotel's concierge desk. Duties included:

- Provided fit for purpose sight visit recommendations to guests, sold tickets to London tourist sights, tours, and theater shows
- Liaised with accounting regarding invoicing and ticketing
- Trained and mentored two employees in concierge duties.

Significantly improved sales by focusing on customer service and marketing.
profile_positions.title: Concierge Manager
